name: Side channels
functionStatement: Examines the role of bank processes and erosion in channel change. Observes patterns in sinuosity and curvature affecting habitat complexity.
descriptionMarkdown: Assesses whether planform and number of active threads match the natural setting, considering straightening, braiding, and side-channel connectivity.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Map connected side channels and verify likely connection thresholds at about bankfull stage using field checks or elevation profiles.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Multiple side channels remain connected at bankfull or moderate high flows.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Some off-channel areas exist but are partially disconnected.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Few mostly inactive channels with connectivity only during large floods.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: No meaningful side-channel function remains despite appropriate valley setting.

references: LiDAR profiles for connection sills (where available)
